articles.description: The French President claims Russia is running a disinformation campaign to damage this summer's games.
articles.title: Paris 2024: Russia seeking to undermine Games, says Emmanuel Macron

articles.description: The WTA Finals will be held in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, for the next three years and will also offer record prize money.
articles.title: Saudi Arabia to host the WTA Finals for next three years and provide record prize money

articles.description: Frida Maanum has undergone tests which found "no obvious cardiac causes" for her collapse in the Continental Cup final, say her club Arsenal.
articles.title: 'No obvious cardiac causes' for Maanum collapse

articles.description: The soccer star was waiting to be served at a petrol station when two gunmen opened fire on him, police say.
articles.title: Luke Fleurs: South African footballer shot dead in car hijacking

articles.description: Australia spinner Nathan Lyon is disappointed his spell at Lancashire this summer will be shortened to manage his workload.
articles.title: Lyon 'disappointed' by shortened Lancashire stint

articles.description: Phil Foden's "masterclass" against Aston Villa again underlines his "precious value" to Manchester City, writes Phil McNulty.
articles.title: 'Special Foden steals show in absence of Haaland & De Bruyne'

articles.description: England's Tyrrell Hatton opens up on his decision to leave the PGA Tour at the start of 2024 and join his Ryder Cup team-mate Jon Rahm at LIV Golf.
articles.title: Tyrrell Hatton's LIV Golf move helped by Jon Rahm's switch to Saudi Arabia-funded circuit

articles.description: Four-time world champion Sebastian Vettel says he has been thinking about coming out of retirement but it is not his "number one priority".
articles.title: Sebastian Vettel: Former Formula 1 world champion thinking about comeback

articles.description: The Boston Celtics secure home court advantage for the NBA play-offs by clinching the top seed place.
articles.title: NBA round-up: Boston Celtics beat Oklahoma City Thunder to secure top spot

articles.description: Defender Leah Williamson is ready to make her England return after a year out, says manager Sarina Wiegman.
articles.title: Williamson 'fit and ready' for England return
